qas.question: Who has studied the lives of wrestlers?
When did Beyond the Mat come out?
Who are a few wrestlers who have had memoirs written about them?

answers.text: Chris Jericho, Rob Van Dam and Roddy Piper

context: <a0_0>Documentary filmmakers<a0_0/> have studied the lives of wrestlers and the effects the profession has on them and their families. The <a1_0>1999<a1_0/> theatrical documentary Beyond the Mat focused on Terry Funk, a wrestler nearing retirement; Mick Foley, a wrestler within his prime; Jake Roberts, a former star fallen from grace; and a school of wrestling student trying to break into the business. The 2005 release Lipstick and Dynamite, Piss and Vinegar: The First Ladies of Wrestling chronicled the development of women's wrestling throughout the 20th century. Pro wrestling has been featured several times on HBO's Real Sports with <a2_0>Bryant Gumbel<a2_0/>. MTV's documentary series True Life featured two episodes titled "I'm a Professional Wrestler" and "I Want to Be a Professional Wrestler". Other documentaries have been produced by The Learning Channel (The Secret World of Professional Wrestling) and A&E (Hitman Hart: Wrestling with Shadows). Bloodstained Memoirs explored the careers of several pro wrestlers, including <a3_0>Chris Jericho, Rob Van Dam and Roddy Piper<a3_0/>.
